Posts.Content: On Apr 17, 2015 6:51 PM mcon1973 wrote: On Apr 17, 2015 11:57 AM seekingresults wrote: On Nov 21, 2014 10:14 PM mcon1973 wrote: My mom has breast cancer and it has now spread. She has a mass in the middle of her chest which will soon cut off her air way to a lung and eventually block blood to her heart and lungs.  The Dr. told us she has weeks to months to live. I don't take that at face value because of all the stories I hear about people having an expiration date and they outlive the time given.  My problem is, I am feeling like I have failed as a son. I thought I would be ok with this but after we were told, I haven't stopped crying. I wanted to do so much for my mother but was always so busy with my own issues.  I am so lost right now and just want to shut down and not do anything or see anyone. I am currently in the middle of obtaining my MBA and I have lost all interest.  I'm not sure what to expect here but I just needed to get this out. I don't want my mother to die, I want her to stay here so I can be a better son.  I'm so lost... Hi mcon1973 I am in the same situation as you. It's totally shattering and I don't know how to deal with it either except cry. I too feel like I've let down my mother. I didn't realise she was so ill as doctors kept saying they thought they could maintain it but it hasn't worked out that way and treatment after treatment isn't working now so we are down to weeks. Can I ask did your mother pass away? My sincere condolences if she has. If not, what treatment did you take up? I am researching on the internet for anything to help but there's so much information out there I don't know what to believe and don't want to make her quality of life any worse than it is. Wishing you all the very best  Hi, Unfortunately, my mother passed on January 4th. It went from 0 to 100 within weeks. One moment she was here and the next she was bed ridden and lethargic. I hope your mom gets better but if I can make any sense of it all, ultimately everything will be ok. Hi, I am so sorry to hear that your mum passed away. My mum too is bedridden after a few weeks so unfortunately sounds similar to your situation. It makes you realise how very short life is and I hope you fulfill all of your dreams and have a wonderful life ahead of you as our mum's would wish us. All the best and thank you again for taking the time to write back to me. If you have any advice on how you talked to your mum while she was so ill I would really appreciate it. We don't really talk about the cancer and I'm not sure if that's good or not... If you don't want to discuss anymore I totally understand and again wish you much happiness and joy in your journey ahead and thank you for your kindness in responding to my original message

Posts.Content: Thank you so much. We tried a little bit of juicing earlier in the year but the last chemo she had has given her such bad mouth ulcers she can hardly eat or drink and so most fruit is too acidic. Hopefully they'll clear soon. I'm starting to puree plain vegetables for her so hopefully that helps. And I understand the loss of site analogy. Thank you again for connecting and helping me when you are going through such a difficult time. I appreciate your kindness and generosity. I too hope everything is ok with you and your family and good luck with your MBA. If you need to email in future to get anything off your chest please just send a message to me

Posts.Content: On Apr 18, 2015 2:27 AM mcon1973 wrote: If I had to do it all over again, the one thing I would do is spend a lot more time with her. I went about my life as if she would just magically get better. I wouldn't go visit her as often as I should because I wanted her to rest and not be bothered but now I regret not trying to spend as much time with her as I could.  My normal visit would involve making sure my mom was comfortable and attending to her needs. I wish I would have video taped the little time we spent together. I was just so traumatized that I almost avoided a lot of interaction with her. Also, I wish I could've told her that it was ok to go if she wanted.  There was just so much I regret not doing and I would just say do it all. Now that my mom isn't here, I torture myself with things I wished I would've said and done. Just do it and if your mom doesn't make it, at least you can say you said and did all you could to make the time as best as it could be for the both of you. This is the first time, I've really discussed any of this outside of my family and it's theraputic so feel free to ask any questions you have. Sorry you and your mom are going through this but someway or the other, everything will be ok.  Thank you. I am trying to see her as much as I can. My Dad visits her everyday and I am trying to go most days but we have to work around her sister too visiting her as she is too weak to have too many visitors at once. But thank you cause I too originally didn't want to tire her out because I know she gets tired with the constant tests, and checks the nurses and doctors do at the hospital...but I will visit her as much as I can. I have thought about video taping, but I am not sure she'd want that as she wouldn't want us remembering her like this (I think. She looks so frail and weak and originally she wouldn't let us visit her when she went downhill dramatically because she didn't want to upset us). I have just had a baby too so I wanted to get her to write or say a message to him but I don't know how to bring it up. Hmm I already have regrets with my life like you mention too. I regret not having a baby earlier as now I feel I've taken away her opportunity to be a grandmother to my child (which she was so excited about and I know that causes her great distress that she won't get to watch him grow up) and I was waiting to get married as I wanted a child first to meet her but not I regret that too. I guess it's natural to have many regrets in situations such as this and I guess we will learn from them. My mum's own mum passed away when I was a baby so I really didn't think lightning would strike twice as they say. But my mum was such a beautiful and positive woman and I wonder if it's because she realised at a young age how precious life was and she made the most of the life she was given.  Also one other question I think you were originally looking at alternatives. Was the reason you didn't try anything else because her situation deteriorated so quickly? Unfortunately my mum has said she'll try anything and we can't find the 'anything' for her to try. I just hope other families don't have to go through this and that a cure is found sooner rather than later. I hope your regrets pass in time. If you have any other advice (you mention there was so much you regretted not doing or saying. Anything else you care to mention?) I really appreciate to hear it. And I am glad this is therapeutic for you as it is most probably good to get this out and off your chest. I too don't talk to people about it either. Mainly because it's changed so dramatically from ok to bad and because it's too emotional and a lot of people don't understand. If you need to say anything to make yourself feel better please do.

Posts.Content: On Jun 13, 2013 1:33 AM SpringFlowers wrote: Suebo, Yes, there are many alternative sites, and many are to be very wary of.  I didn't just dive in without indepth study and many questions, just as you.   I think it's best to look for cures for your 'cancer specific" type...brain, breast, etc.  As well as with me, breast cancer--DCIS.  I know that inflammatory breast cancer and Triple Negative are really beastly and need a very strict regimine.  Looking back on what i've done, don't think I had such a bumpy road.  I figured since 5 oncologists had already told me to "prepare" with at most 18 months, I had nothing to lose.  Here it is 36 months later and all tumor markers are normal, two under the normal, all bloodwork, stats perfect, no fatigue, no pain and if I don't think about that beast, hardly know I've been bitten.  I'm certainly not bragging, I am just thankful God has smiled on me and allowed me to find the right road to travel.  Cancer is nothing to be "bravado" about, it is a disgusting, low life beast that robs not only the sufferer, but destroys friendships and family ties in many instances.  I have been lucky that I have good family that has hauled me up on those miserasble days.  My daughter was with me from time I was DX'd, never fails to call.  My son as well, and my dear daughter in law.  I have the best husband I could ever hope for, so considerate and caring....I feel awful for him.  This is our second marriage, he lost his first wife from breast cancer; she was only 34, leaving him with 2 small boys....and not a clue where to pick up, but we put a wonderful family together with my two and his two, then again the scum beast reared it's ugly head and took our son at 42 with lung cancer, such a dear young man in his prime with so much to live for...so, I am not frivilous in my thinking.   I do know from all the books i've read that cancer is indeed Anaerobic, and only a good diet can combat that particular illness, so immediately I went on strict diet and have kept my body alkaline.  It was a bit hard at first, but now just seems natural.  I can only tell you what i've done, be wary of those clinic's in Mexico, they will bleed you dry and you can do the same thing at home for a few hundred dollars where they will charge you upwards of $50,000 - yes, Fifty Thousand, plus, plus, plus.  I know people who have gone and they are no better off.  Just do the simple things i've done, they work just as well.  I can send you a copy of my scan report and tumor markers/bloodwork.  I do not lie about such a serious condition.  First, start with the Jim Kelmum Protocol...google it.  That got all the cancer out of my soft tissue, lungs, liver, etc.    If you want me to send you list of nutrients, will be very happy to do so.  Very simple, and as I mentioned, very inexpensive.  I may have spent around $80.00 to get started, then just replenish as needed.   If you've heard of IPT therapy, such as the Linchitz Clinic in NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">NewYork-LinchitzWellness.com     Jim Kelmun Protocol is much the same, only dirt cheap, but it works.  If you've had any chemistry, even high school, remember how baking soda activates in liquid and creates oxygen...does the same in your body.  Cancer cells are killed by oxygen.   Just let me know if you want the entire "what I did" will be glad to email to you....no, money not involved, just a bit wordy and don't want to take up so much room on here, also, you'd be surprised how hostile people are when you say alternative, yet I don't see any great cures with chemo.   Nor did my friend who was Dx'd same week as me.  She went the whole way, mastectomy/Lymph node removal, chemo, radiation, reconstruction, then death.   She was only Stage 3 when Dx'd, I was Stage 4.  She passed a year later, i'm still here.  I take NO joy in that, but I do know doc's are painting everyone with the same brush from the same paint can knowing it doesn't work.  I opted for LaserSurgery to have my tumor and all the smaller tumors and splatters as well as only 5 lymph nodes removed and I know that was the saving grace.  Without what I call the Mother Ship spewing cancer cells into the body, seems easy to understand why i've had such good results.   Anyone can, i'm no genuis, but I love myself enough to want to know, learn and then do all I can to enjoy my family and friends as long as possible.  I know Christ is my goal, but I think He put a brain in our head to use at times like these, and i've sure been thru the lessons.    Just let me know if you want a list of the nutrients and what I did, very simple, easy and for me, very effective.   Blessings. Hi Springflowers Hope you are doing well. It was so nice to read your story about how your cancer has been cleared. My mother unfortunately has advanced breast cancer to bladder, around bowel, in lining of lung, in stomach lining and spine. She is doing it quite tough at the moment and has been in hospital most of this year. She had strong chemo about one month ago and it has left her bed ridden and in a poor state. You mentioned being able to email a list of supplements/nutrients you took. I would love to find out exactly what you did as I would like to replicate this for my mum. I also read in an earlier post you said your voice went away for a while but came back. My mothers' voice is very weak at the moment also and she is having laboured breathing. I suspect from the cancer in the lining of her lung. Do you know why your voice went away? If you are still on this website please let me know so we can make email contact.  Many thanks and best regards and hope to hear from you soon
